a.g: Ya, Seen.
By the wise Qur'an.
Indeed you, [O Muhammad], are from among the messengers,
On a straight path.
[This is] a revelation of the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,
That you may warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, so they are unaware.
Already the word has come into effect upon most of them, so they do not believe.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
يخفى فيه الشرك الخفي الذي هو أخفى من دبيب النملة السوداء في الليلة الظلماء فلا يخفى على هذا النور خافية ولا يروج عليه شيء من مكايد الشيطان بل يقف الشيطان ويوحي زخرف القول غرورا فلا يلتفت إليه وهذا القلب بعد طهارته من المهلكات يصير على القرب معمورا بالمنجيات التي سنذكرها من الشكر والصبر والخوف والرجاء والفقر والزهد والمحبة والرضا والشوق والتوكل والتفكر والمحاسبة وغير ذلك وهو القلب الذي أقبل الله عز وجل بوجهه عليه وهو القلب المطمئن المراد بقوله تعالى ألا بذكر الله تطمئن القلوب وبقوله عز وجل يا أيتها النفس المطمئنة القلب الثاني القلب المخذول المشحون بالهوى المدنس بالأخلاق المذمومة والخبائث المفتوح فيه أبواب الشياطين المسدود عنه أبواب الملائكة ومبدأ الشر فيه أن ينقدح فيه خاطر من الهوى ويهجس فيه فينظر القلب إلى حاكم العقل ليستفتي منه ويستكشف وجه الصواب فيه فيكون العقل قد ألف خدمة الهوى وأنس به واستمر على استنباط الحيل له وعلى مساعدة الهوى فتستولي النفس وتساعد عليه فينشرح الصدر بالهوى وتنبسط فيه ظلماته لانحباس جند العقل عن مدافعته فيقوى سلطان الشيطان لاتساع مكانه بسبب انتشار الهوى فيقبل عليه بالتزيين والغرور والأماني ويوحي بذلك زخرفا من القول غرورا فيضعف سلطان الإيمان بالوعد والوعيد ويخبو نور اليقين لخوف الآخرة إذ يتصاعد عن الهوى دخان مظلم إلى القلب يملأ جوانبه حتى تنطفيء أنواره فيصير العقل كالعين التي ملأ الدخان أجفانها فلا يقدر على أن ينظر وهكذا تفعل غلبة الشهوة بالقلب حتى لا يبقى للقلب إمكان التوقف والاستبصار ولو بصره واعظ وأسمعه ما هو الحق فيه عمى عن الفهم وصم عن السمع وهاجت الشهوة فيه وسطا الشيطان وتحركت الجوارح على وفق الهوى فظهرت المعصية إلى عالم الشهادة من عالم الغيب بقضاء من الله تعالى وقدره وإلى مثل هذا القلب الإشارة بقوله تعالى أرأيت من اتخذ إلهه هواه أفأنت تكون عليه وكيلا أم تحسب أن أكثرهم يسمعون أو يعقلون إن هم إلا كالأنعام بل هم أضل سبيلا وبقوله عز وجل لقد حق القول على أكثرهم فهم لا يؤمنون وبقوله سواء عليهم أأنذرتهم أم لم تنذرهم لا يؤمنون
Indeed, within it is concealed the hidden polytheism [shirk khafi] which is more hidden than the crawling of a black ant on a dark night. Yet, nothing hidden remains concealed from this light [nur], nor can any of Satan's stratagems succeed against it. Rather, Satan stands confounded, and he whispers embellished speech as delusion, but no heed is paid to him. And this heart [qalb], after its purification from destructive traits, becomes, in proximity [qurb], inhabited by salvific traits which we will mention: gratitude [shukr], patience [sabr], fear [khawf], hope [raja'], poverty [faqr], asceticism [zuhd], love [mahabba], contentment [rida'], longing [shawq], reliance [tawakkul], reflection [tafakkur], self-reckoning [muhasaba], and others besides. This is the heart upon which God, Mighty and Majestic, has turned His Countenance, and it is the contented heart [al-qalb al-mutma'inn] intended by His saying, Exalted is He: "Is it not in the remembrance of God that hearts find contentment?" and by His saying, Mighty and Majestic: "O contented soul [al-nafs al-mutma'inna]!" The second heart is the forsaken heart [al-qalb al-makhdhul], crammed with caprice [hawa], defiled by blameworthy traits and vile things, its gates opened to the satans and its gates to the angels closed. The origin of evil within it is that a thought [khātir] from caprice sparks within it and whispers. The heart then looks to the ruler, the intellect [al-'aql], to seek a legal opinion from it and to discover the face of correctness in the matter. But the intellect has grown accustomed to serving caprice, become intimate with it, and persisted in devising stratagems for it and in aiding caprice. Thus, the soul [al-nafs] gains mastery and assists it. The breast expands with caprice, and its darknesses spread within it due to the withholding of the intellect's army from repelling it. The authority of Satan strengthens due to the expanse of his place caused by the spread of caprice. He turns to it with embellishment, delusion, and false hopes, and he whispers to it embellished speech as delusion. The authority of faith [iman] in the promise and the threat weakens, and the light of certainty [nur al-yaqin] regarding the fear of the Hereafter dims, for a dark smoke ascends from caprice to the heart, filling its corners until its lights are extinguished. The intellect thus becomes like an eye whose eyelids are filled with smoke, unable to see. This is what the dominance of desire [shahwa] does to the heart, until no possibility remains for the heart to pause and gain insight [istibsar]. Even if an admonisher were to show it and make it hear what is true in the matter, it would be blind to understanding and deaf to hearing. Desire rages within it, Satan triumphs, and the limbs move in accordance with caprice. Thus, disobedience [ma'siya] appears from the unseen realm [alam al-ghayb] into the realm of witness [alam al-shahada] by the decree and destiny of God, Exalted is He. To such a heart is the allusion in His saying, Exalted is He: "Have you seen him who takes his caprice as his god? Would you then be a guardian over him?" and "Or do you suppose that most of them hear or understand? They are but like cattle; nay, they are further astray from the way," and in His saying, Mighty and Majestic: "The word has been justified against most of them, for they do not believe," and in His saying: "Alike it is to them whether you warn them or warn them not; they do not believe."

a.g: Indeed, We have put shackles on their necks, and they are to their chins, so they are with heads [kept] aloft.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال الضحاك في قوله تعالى "إنا جعلنا في أعناقهم أغلالاً" قال: البخل، أمسك الله تعالى أيديهم عن النفقة في سبيل الله فهم لا يبصرون الهدى.
Indeed, We have placed shackles [aghlāl] upon their necks. Al-Dahhak said regarding His, the Exalted's, saying: "Indeed, We have placed shackles [aghlāl] upon their necks." He said: It is miserliness [al-bukhl]. Allah, the Exalted, has restrained their hands from spending in the path of Allah, so they do not perceive the guidance [al-hudā].

a.g: And We have put before them a barrier and behind them a barrier and covered them, so they do not see.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وكذلك صغائر المعاصي يجر بعضها إلى بعض حتى يفوت أصل السعادة بهدم أصل الإيمان عند الخاتمة. فكذا من يستهين صغائر المعاصي ويسوف نفسه بالتوبة على التوالي إلى أن يختطفه الموت بغتة أو تتراكم ظلمة الذنوب على قلبه وتتعذر عليه التوبة، إذ القليل يدعو إلى الكثير فيصير القلب مقيداً بسلاسل شهوات لا يمكن تخليصه من مخالبها. وهو المعنى بانسداد باب التوبة وهو المراد بقوله تعالى "وجعلنا من بين أيديهم سداً ومن خلفهم سداً" الآية ولذلك قال رضي الله عنه "إن الإيمان ليبدو في القلب نكتة بيضاء، كلما ازداد الإيمان ازداد ذلك البياض فإذا استكمل العبد الإيمان أبيض القلب كله. وإن النفاق في القلب ليبدو نكتة سوداء كلما ازداد النفاق ازداد ذلك السواد فإذا استكمل النفاق أسود القلب كله."
Indeed, likewise, minor sins [sagha'ir al-ma'asi] lead one to another until the very foundation of felicity [asl al-sa'ada] is lost through the demolition of the very foundation of faith [asl al-iman] at the final moment [al-khatima]. So it is for one who takes minor sins lightly and continually postpones repentance [tawba] for himself, until death snatches him suddenly, or the darkness of sins [zulmat al-dhunub] accumulates upon his heart [qalb] and repentance becomes impossible for him. For the little invites to the much, until the heart becomes shackled by the chains of desires [shahawat] from whose claws it cannot be freed. This is the meaning of the closing of the door of repentance [bab al-tawba], and this is what is intended by His saying, the Exalted: "And We have placed before them a barrier and behind them a barrier" [Quran 36:9]. And for this reason, he – may God be pleased with him – said: "Indeed, faith [iman] appears in the heart as a white spot [nukta bayda']. Whenever faith increases, that whiteness increases, until when the servant [al-'abd] completes his faith, his entire heart becomes white. And indeed, hypocrisy [nifaq] appears in the heart as a black spot [nukta sawda']. Whenever hypocrisy increases, that blackness increases, until when hypocrisy is complete, the entire heart becomes black."

a.g: And it is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them - they will not believe.
You can only warn one who follows the message and fears the Most Merciful unseen. So give him good tidings of forgiveness and noble reward.
Indeed, it is We who bring the dead to life and record what they have put forth and what they left behind, and all things We have enumerated in a clear register.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى ونكتب ما قدموا وآثارهم أي نكتب أيضا ما أخروه من آثار أعمالهم كما نكتب ما قدموه وفي مثله قوله تعالى ينبأ الإنسان يومئذ بما قدم وأخر وإنما أخر آثار أعماله من سنة سيئة عمل بها غيره.
Indeed, We write what they have sent forth [qaddamu] and their traces [atharahum]. That is, We also write what they have left behind of the traces [athar] of their deeds, just as We write what they have sent forth. And in its likeness is His saying: "Man will be informed on that Day of what he sent forth [qaddama] and what he left behind [akhkhara]." And what he left behind [akhkhara] are only the traces [athar] of his deeds—from an evil practice [sunnah sayyi'ah] that another acted upon.

a.g: And present to them an example: the people of the city, when the messengers came to it -
When We sent to them two but they denied them, so We strengthened them with a third, and they said, "Indeed, we are messengers to you."
They said, "You are not but human beings like us, and the Most Merciful has not revealed a thing. You are only telling lies."
They said, "Our Lord knows that we are messengers to you,
And we are not responsible except for clear notification."
They said, "Indeed, we consider you a bad omen. If you do not desist, we will surely stone you, and there will surely touch you, from us, a painful punishment."
They said, "Your omen is with yourselves. Is it because you were reminded? Rather, you are a transgressing people."
And there came from the farthest end of the city a man, running. He said, "O my people, follow the messengers.
Follow those who do not ask of you [any] payment, and they are [rightly] guided.
And why should I not worship He who created me and to whom you will be returned?
Should I take other than Him [false] deities [while], if the Most Merciful intends for me some adversity, their intercession will not avail me at all, nor can they save me?
Indeed, I would then be in manifest error.
Indeed, I have believed in your Lord, so listen to me."
It was said, "Enter Paradise." He said, "I wish my people could know
Of how my Lord has forgiven me and placed me among the honored."
And We did not send down upon his people after him any soldiers from the heaven, nor would We have done so.
It was not but one shout, and immediately they were extinguished.
How regretful for the servants. There did not come to them any messenger except that they used to ridicule him.
Have they not considered how many generations We destroyed before them - that they to them will not return?
And indeed, all of them will yet be brought present before Us.
And a sign for them is the dead earth. We have brought it to life and brought forth from it grain, and from it they eat.
And We placed therein gardens of palm trees and grapevines and caused to burst forth therefrom some springs -
That they may eat of His fruit. And their hands have not produced it, so will they not be grateful?
Exalted is He who created all pairs - from what the earth grows and from themselves and from that which they do not know.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
اعلم أن كل ما في الوجود مما سوى الله تعالى فهو فعل الله وخلقه وكل ذرة من الذرات من جوهر وعرض وصفة وموصوف ففيها عجائب وغرائب تظهر بها حكمة الله وقدرته وجلاله وعظمته وإحصاء ذلك غير ممكن لأنه لو كان البحر مدادا لذلك لنفد البحر قبل أن ينفد عشر عشيره ولكنا نشير إلى جمل منه ليكون ذلك كالمثال لماعداه فنقول الموجودات المخلوقة منقسمة الى مالا يعرف أصلها فلا يمكننا التفكر فيها وكم من الموجودات التى لا نعلمها كما قال الله تعالى ويخلق ما لا تعلمون سبحان الذي خلق الأزواج كلها مما تنبت الأرض ومن أنفسهم ومما لا يعلمون وقال وننشئكم فيما لا تعلمون وإلى ما يعرف أصلها وجملتها ولا يعرف تفصيلها فيمكننا أن نتفكر في تفصيلها وهي منقسمة إلى ما أدركناه بحس البصر وإلى ما لا ندركه بالبصر أما الذي لا ندركه بالبصر فكالملائكة والجن والشياطين والعرش والكرسي وغير ذلك ومجال الفكر في هذه الأشياء مما يضيق ويغمض فلنعدل إلى الأقرب إلى الأفهام وهي المدركات بحس البصر وذلك هو السموات السبع والأرض وما بينهما فالسموات مشاهدة بكواكبها وشمسها وقمرها وحركتها ودورانها في طلوعها وغروبها والأرض مشاهدة بما فيها من جبالها ومعادنها وأنهارها وبحارها وحيوانها ونباتها وما بين السماء والأرض وهو الجو مدرك بغيومها وأمطارها وثلوجها ورعدها وبرقها وصواعقها وشهبها وعواصف رياحها فهذه هي الأجناس المشاهدة من السموات والأرض وما بينهما وكل جنس منها ينقسم إلى أنواع وكل نوع ينقسم إلى أقسام ويتشعب كل قسم إلى أصناف ولا نهاية لانشعاب ذلك وانقسامه في اختلاف صفاته وهيآته ومعانيه الظاهرة والباطنة وجميع ذلك مجال الفكر فلا تتحرك ذرة في السموات والأرض من جماد ولا نبات ولا حيوان ولا فلك ولا كوكب إلا والله تعالى هو محركها وفي حركتها حكمة أو حكمتان أو عشر أو ألف حكمة كل ذلك شاهد لله تعالى بالوحدانية ودال على جلاله وكبريائه وهي الآيات الدالة عليه وقد ورد القرآن بالحث على التفكر في هذه الايات كما قال الله تعالى إن في خلق السموات والأرض واختلاف الليل والنهار لآيات لأولي الألباب وكما قال تعالى ومن آياته من أول القرآن إلى آخره فلنذكر كيفية الفكر في بعض الآيات فمن آياته الانسان المخلوق من النطفة وأقرب شيء إليك نفسك وفيك من العجائب الدالة على عظمة الله تعالى ما تنقضي الأعمار في الوقوف على عشر عشيره وأنت غافل عنه فيامن هو غافل عن نفسه وجاهل بها كيف تطمع في معرفة غيرك وقد أمرك الله تعالى بالتدبر في نفسك في كتابه العزيز فقال وفي أنفسكم أفلا تبصرون وذكر أنك مخلوق من نطفة قذرة فقال قتل الإنسان ما أكفره من أي شئ خلقه
Know that everything in existence besides God, the Most High, is the act [fi'l] of God and His creation [khalq]. Every single atom [dharrah] among the atoms, whether substance [jawhar] or accident ['arad], attribute [sifah] or thing described [mawsuf], contains wonders ['aja'ib] and marvels [ghara'ib] through which the wisdom [hikmah] of God, His power [qudrah], His majesty [jalal], and His greatness ['azamah] are made manifest. To enumerate that is not possible, for if the sea were ink for that, the sea would be exhausted before a tenth of its tenth was exhausted. Yet, we point to a summary of it so that it may serve as an example for what lies beyond it. We say: The created existents [mawjudat al-makhluqah] are divided into that whose origin [asl] is not known, so we cannot contemplate [tafakkur] upon it. How many existents are there that we do not know, as God, the Most High, has said: **"And He creates what you do not know."** Glory be to Him Who created all pairs, from what the earth grows and from themselves and from what they do not know. And He said: **"And We will develop you into what you do not know."** And into that whose origin and totality [jumlatiha] are known, but whose details [tafsil] are not known, so we can contemplate upon its details. And it is divided into what we perceive [nadrikuhu] by the sense of sight [hass al-basar], and into what we do not perceive by sight. As for what we do not perceive by sight, such as the angels, the jinn, the devils, the Throne ['Arsh], the Footstool [Kursi], and other than that, the scope for thought [majal al-fikr] in these things is that which constricts and becomes obscure. So let us turn to what is closer to comprehension, which is that which is perceived by the sense of sight. And that is the seven heavens [al-samawat] and the earth [al-ard] and what is between them. The heavens are witnessed [mushahadah] with their stars, their sun, their moon, their movement, and their rotation in their rising and setting. The earth is witnessed with what it contains of its mountains, its minerals, its rivers, its seas, its animals, and its plants. And what is between the heaven and the earth, which is the atmosphere [al-jaww], is perceived [mudrak] with its clouds, its rains, its snows, its thunder, its lightning, its thunderbolts, its shooting stars, and its stormy winds. These are the witnessed genera [al-ajnas al-mushahadah] of the heavens, the earth, and what is between them. Every genus [jins] among them divides into species [anwa'], and every species divides into categories [aqsam], and every category branches out [yatasha'abb] into varieties [asnaf]. And there is no end to the branching and division of that in the difference of its attributes [sifat], its states [hay'at], and its apparent [zahirah] and hidden [batinah] meanings. And all of that is a scope for thought [majal al-fikr]. Not a single atom [dharrah] moves in the heavens and the earth, whether inanimate [jamad], plant [nabat], animal [hayawan], celestial sphere [falak], or star [kawkab], except that God, the Most High, is its mover. And in its movement is a wisdom [hikmah], or two wisdoms, or ten, or a thousand wisdoms. All of that bears witness [shahid] for God, the Most High, to His Oneness [wahdaniyah] and points to His majesty [jalal] and His greatness [kibriya']. And these are the signs [ayat] pointing to Him. And the Qur'an has come urging contemplation [tafakkur] upon these signs, as God, the Most High, has said: **"Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth and the alternation of the night and the day are signs for those of understanding."** And as He, the Most High, has said: **"And among His signs..."** from the beginning of the Qur'an to its end. So let us mention the manner of contemplation [kayfiyat al-fikr] upon some of the signs. Among His signs is the human [al-insan], created from a sperm-drop [nutfah]. The closest thing to you is your own self [nafs]. And within you are wonders ['aja'ib] pointing to the greatness ['azamah] of God, the Most High, that lifetimes would end before standing upon a tenth of its tenth, while you are heedless [ghafil] of it. So O you who are heedless of your own self and ignorant [jahil] of it, how do you aspire to know other than yourself? And God, the Most High, has commanded you to reflect [tadabbur] upon your self in His Mighty Book, saying: **"And in yourselves. Then will you not see?"** And He reminded that you are created from a foul sperm-drop, saying: **"Destroyed is man; how disbelieving he is. From what thing did He create him?"**

a.g: And a sign for them is the night. We remove from it [the light of] day, so they are [left] in darkness.
And the sun runs [on course] toward its stopping point. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
And the moon - We have determined for it phases, until it returns [appearing] like the old date stalk.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال عز وجل: (والقمر قدرناه منازل حتى عاد كالعرجون القديم( (يس: 39). والثاني: الأحكام، وحاصله يرجع إلى الاستدلال على الحوادث بالأسباب وهو يضاهي استدلال الطبيب بالنبض على ما سيحدث من المرض وهو معرفة لمجاري سنة الله تعالى وعادته في خلقه ولكن قد ذمه الشرع قال صلى الله عليه وسلم: (إذا ذكر القدر فأمسكوا وإذا ذكرت النجوم فأمسكوا وإذا ذكر أصحابي فأمسكوا). وقال صلى الله عليه وسلم: (أخاف على أمتي بعدي ثلاثا حيف الأئمة والإيمان بالنجوم والتكذيب بالقدر). وقال عمر بن الخطاب رضي الله عنه: تعلموا من النجوم ما تهتدون به في البر والبحر ثم أمسكوا. وإنما زجر عنه من ثلاثة أوجه: أحدها: أنه مضر بأكثر الخلق فإنه إذا ألقى إليهم أن هذه الآثار تحدث عقيب سير الكواكب وقع في نفوسهم أن الكواكب هي المؤثرة وأنها الآلهة المدبرة لأنها جواهر شريفة سماوية ويعظم وقعها في القلوب فيبقى القلب ملتفتا إليها ويرى الخير والشر محذورا أو مرجوا من جهتها وينمحي ذكر الله سبحانه عن القلب فإنه الضعيف يقصر نظره على الوسائط والعالم الراسخ هو الذي يطلع على أن الشمس والقمر والنجوم مسخرات بأمره سبحانه وتعالى ومثال نظر الضعيف إلى حصول ضوء الشمس عقيب طلوع الشمس مثال النملة لو خلق لها عقل وكانت على سطح قرطاس وهي تنظر إلى سواد الخط يتجدد فتعتقد أنه فعل القلم ولا تترقى في نظرها إلى مشاهدة الأصابع ثم منها إلى اليد ثم منها إلى الإرادة المحركة اليد ثم منها إلى الكاتب القادر المريد ثم منه إلى خالق اليد والقدرة والإرادة فأكثر نظر الخلق مقصور على الأسباب القريبة السافلة مقطوع من الترقي إلى مسبب الأسباب فهذا أحد أسباب النهي عن النجوم.
And He, the Mighty and Majestic, said: "And the moon [al-qamar]—We have determined for it phases [manazil], until it returns like the old date stalk [al-'urjun al-qadim]" (Ya-Sin: 39). The second [meaning] is the judgments [al-ahkam], and its essence refers to deducing events based on causes [al-asbab], and this resembles a doctor deducing what illness will occur from the pulse. It is a knowledge [ma'rifa] of the courses of the custom [sunnah] of Allah, the Exalted, and His habit in His creation. But the Law [al-shar'] has indeed censured it. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When predestination [al-qadar] is mentioned, refrain. And when the stars [al-nujum] are mentioned, refrain. And when my companions are mentioned, refrain." And the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "I fear for my nation after me three things: the injustice of rulers, belief in the stars [al-nujum], and denial of predestination [al-qadar]." And 'Umar ibn al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, said: "Learn from the stars what guides you on land and sea, then refrain." And it was prohibited for three reasons: The first of them: It is harmful to most of creation [al-khalq]. For if it is presented to them that these effects occur following the course of the planets, it settles in their souls [nufus] that the planets are the effectors and that they are the gods [alihah] managing affairs, because they are noble, celestial substances [jawhar], and their impact is great upon the hearts [qulub]. Thus, the heart [qalb] remains attentive to them, and it sees good and evil as something to be feared or hoped for from their direction, and the remembrance [dhikr] of Allah, glory be to Him, is erased from the heart [qalb]. For the weak one [al-da'if] restricts his gaze to the intermediaries [al-wasa'it], while the firmly-grounded knower [al-'alim al-rasikh] is the one who perceives that the sun, the moon, and the stars are subjugated by His command, glory be to Him, the Exalted. The example of the weak one's gaze upon the occurrence of sunlight following the sunrise is like an ant—if intellect were created for it and it were on the surface of a paper, looking at the blackness of a line being renewed—it would believe it is the action of the pen, and its gaze would not ascend to witnessing the fingers, then from them to the hand, then from it to the will [al-iradah] moving the hand, then from it to the writer who is capable and willing, then from him to the Creator of the hand, the capability, and the will. Thus, the gaze of most of creation [al-khalq] is restricted to the lowly, proximate causes [al-asbab], severed from ascending to the Causer of Causes [musabbib al-asbab]. This is one of the reasons for the prohibition regarding the stars.

a.g: It is not allowable for the sun to reach the moon, nor does the night overtake the day, but each, in an orbit, is swimming.
And a sign for them is that We carried their forefathers in a laden ship.
And We created for them from the likes of it that which they ride.
And if We should will, We could drown them; then no one responding to a cry would there be for them, nor would they be saved
Except as a mercy from Us and provision for a time.
But when it is said to them, "Beware of what is before you and what is behind you; perhaps you will receive mercy... "
And no sign comes to them from the signs of their Lord except that they are from it turning away.

And when it is said to them, "Spend from that which Allah has provided for you," those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Should we feed one whom, if Allah had willed, He would have fed? You are not but in clear error."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقد انخدع بمثل هذا الخيال طائفة وسلكوا طريق الإباحة وقالوا إن الله تعالى غنى عن عبادتنا وعن أن يستقرض منا فأي معنى لقوله: ﴿ من ذا الذي يقرض الله قرضا حسنا ﴾ ولو شاء الله إطعام المساكين لأطعمهم فلا حاجة بنا إلى صرف أموالنا إليهم كما قال تعالى حكاية عن الكفار: ﴿ وإذا قيل لهم أنفقوا مما رزقكم الله قال الذين كفروا للذين آمنوا أنطعم من لو يشاء الله أطعمه ﴾ وقالوا أيضا ﴿ لو شاء الله ما أشركنا ولا آباؤنا ﴾ فانظر كيف كانوا صادقين في كلامهم وكيف هلكوا بصدقهم فسبحان من إذا شاء أهلك بالصدق وإذا شاء أسعد بالجهل يضل به كثيرا ويهدى به كثيرا فهؤلاء لما ظنوا أنهم استخدموا لأجل المساكين والفقراء أو جل الله تعالى ثم قالوا لا حظ لنا في المساكين ولا حظ لله فينا وفي أموالنا سواء أنفقنا أو أمسكنا هلكوا كما هلك الصبي لما ظن أن مقصود الوالد استخدامه لأجل العبيد ولم يشعر بأنه كان المقصود ثبات صفة العلم في نفسه وتأكده في قلبه حتى يكون ذلك سبب سعادته في الدنيا وإنما كان ذلك من الوالد تلطفا به في استجراره إلى ما فيه سعادته، فهذا المثال يبين لك ضلال من ضل من هذا الطريق فإذن هذا المسكين الآخذ لمالك يستوفى بواسطة المال خبث البخل وحب الدنيا من باطنك فإنه مهلك لك فهو كالحجام يستخرج الدم منك ليخرج بخروج الدم العلة المهلكة من باطنك فالحجام خادم لك لا أنت خادم للحجام ولا يخرج الحجام عن كونه خادما بأن يكون له غرض في أن يصنع شيئا بالدم ولما كانت الصدقات مطهرة للبواطن ومزكية لها عن خبائث الصفات امتنع رسول الله ﭬ من أخذها وانتهى عنها كما نهى عن كسب الحجام وسماها أوساخ أموال الناس وشرف أهل بيته بالصيانة عنها والمقصود أن الأعمال مؤثرات في القلب كما سبق في ربع المهلكات والقلب بحسب تأثيرها مستعد لقعود الهداية ونور المعرفة فهذا هو القول الكلى والقانون الأصلي الذي ينبغي أن يرجع إليه في معرفة فضائل الأعمال والأحوال والمعارف.
Indeed, a group has been deceived by such imaginings and has taken the path of permissiveness, saying: "God, Exalted is He, is independent of our worship and of borrowing from us. So what meaning is there to His saying: 'Who is it that would loan God a goodly loan [qardan hasanan]?' (Quran 2:245). And if God willed to feed the poor, He would feed them, so there is no need for us to spend our wealth upon them." Just as God, Exalted is He, has narrated from the disbelievers: "And when it is said to them, 'Spend from that which God has provided for you,' those who disbelieve say to those who believe, 'Should we feed one whom, if God had willed, He would have fed?'" (Quran 36:47). And they also said: "If God had willed, we would not have associated [partners with Him] nor would our fathers." (Quran 6:148). So observe how they were truthful in their speech, and how they were destroyed by their truthfulness! Glory be to Him Who, when He wills, destroys with truth, and when He wills, grants felicity with ignorance. He misleads thereby many and guides thereby many. So these people, when they supposed they were employed for the sake of the poor and the needy—exalted is God—and then said, "We have no share in the poor, and God has no share in us or in our wealth, whether we spend or withhold," they were destroyed. Just as the child was destroyed when he supposed the parent's purpose in employing him was for the sake of the servants, and he was not aware that the intended purpose was the establishment of the attribute of knowledge [sifat al-'ilm] in his soul and its firm rooting in his heart [qalb], so that this would be the cause of his felicity [sa'ada] in this world [dunya]. That from the parent was merely gentleness with him, to draw him towards that in which his felicity lies. This example clarifies for you the misguidance of those who have strayed from this path. Therefore, this poor person who takes your wealth is, through the medium of the wealth, extracting the foulness of miserliness and love of this world [hubb al-dunya] from your inner being [batin], for it is destructive to you. He is like the cupper who extracts blood from you so that, with the exit of the blood, the destructive ailment exits from your inner being. The cupper is a servant to you, not you a servant to the cupper. Nor does the cupper cease being a servant by having a purpose in doing something with the blood. And since acts of charity [sadaqat] are purifiers for the inner beings [bawatin] and cleanse them from the foulness of traits, the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, refrained from taking them and abstained from them, just as he forbade the cupper's earnings and called them the filth of people's wealth, and ennobled the people of his household by protecting them from it. The intended meaning is that actions [a'mal] have effects upon the heart [qalb], as preceded in the Quarter of the Destructive Traits. And the heart, according to the effect of these actions, becomes prepared for the descent of guidance [hidaya] and the light [nur] of knowledge [ma'rifa]. This is the universal statement [al-qawl al-kulli] and the fundamental principle [al-qanun al-asli] to which one must return in knowing the virtues of actions, states [ahwal], and knowledges [ma'arif].

a.g: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فلو لم يكن بين يدي الموتي إلا هول تلك النفخة لكان ذلك جديرا بأن يتقى فإنها نفخة وصيحة يصعق بها من فى السموات والأرض يعنى يموتون بها إلا من شاء الله وهو بعض الملائكة ولذلك قال رسول الله ﭬ: (كيف أنعم وصاحب الصور قد التقم القرن وحنى الجبهة وأصغى بالأذن متى يؤمر فينفخ[144]) قال مقاتل: الصور هو القرن وذلك أن إسرافيل عليه السلام واضع فاه على القرن كهيئة البوق ودائرة رأس القرن كعرض السموات والأرض وهو شاخص بصره نحو العرش ينتظر متى يؤمر فينفخ النفخة الأولى فإذا نفخ صعق من فى السموات والأرض أى مات كل حيوان من شدة الفزع إلا من شاء الله وهو جبريل وميكائيل وإسرافيل وملك الموت ثم يأمر ملك الموت أن يقبض روح جبريل ثم روح ميكائيل ثم روح إسرافيل ثم يأمر ملك الموت فيموت ثم يلبث الخلق بعد النفخة الأولى فى البرزخ أربعين سنة ثم يحيى الله تعالى إسرافيل فيأمره أن ينفخ الثانية فذلك قوله تعالى: ﴿ ثم نفخ فيه أخرى فإذا هم قيام ينظرون ﴾ {} على أرجلهم ينظرون إلى البعث وقال رسول الله ﭬ: (حين بعث إلى بعث إلى صاحب الصور فأهوى به إلى فيه وقدم رجلا وأخر أخرى ينتظر متى يؤمر بالنفخ ألا فاتقوا النفخة[145]) فتفكر فى الخلائق وذلهم وانكسارهم واستكانتهم عند الانبعاث خوفا من هذه الصعقة وانتظارا لما يقضى عليهم من سعادة أو شقاوة وأنت فيما بينهم منكسر كانكسارهم متحير كتحيرهم بل إن كنت فى الدنيا من المترفهين والأغنياء المتنعمين فملوك الأرض فى ذلك اليوم أذل أهل أرض الجمع وأصغرهم وأحقرهم يوطئون بالأقدام مثل الذرة وعند ذلك تقبل الوحوش من البرارى والجبال منكسة رءوسها مختلطة بالخلائق بعد توحشها ذليلة ليوم النشور من غير خطيئة تدنست بها ولكن حشرتهم شدة الصعقة وهول النفخة وشغلهم ذلك عن الهرب من الخلق والتوحش منهم
Indeed, if there were nothing before the dead except the terror of that Blast [nafkha], that alone would be worthy of being feared. For it is a Blast [nafkha] and a Shout [sayha] by which all in the heavens and the earth are struck down [yus'iq]—meaning they die by it—except whom Allah wills, and that is some of the angels. And for this reason, the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "How can I enjoy comfort when the Bearer of the Trumpet [Sahib as-Sur] has already taken the Horn [al-qarn] into his mouth, bent his forehead, and inclined his ear, waiting for when he will be commanded to blow?" Muqatil said: The Trumpet [as-Sur] is the Horn [al-qarn]. That is because Israfil, peace be upon him, places his mouth upon the Horn like a trumpet, and the circumference of the head of the Horn is like the breadth of the heavens and the earth. He is gazing with his sight towards the Throne, waiting for when he will be commanded to blow the First Blast. When he blows, all in the heavens and the earth are struck down—meaning every living creature dies from the intensity of the terror—except whom Allah wills, and that is Jibril, Mika'il, Israfil, and the Angel of Death. Then the Angel of Death is commanded to take the soul [ruh] of Jibril, then the soul of Mika'il, then the soul of Israfil. Then the Angel of Death is commanded, and he dies. Then the creation remains after the First Blast in the Barzakh for forty years. Then Allah, the Exalted, revives Israfil and commands him to blow the Second Blast. That is His saying, the Exalted: **"Then it will be blown into it another time, and at once they will be standing, looking on."** —standing on their feet, looking at the Resurrection [al-Ba'th]. And the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "When I was sent, I was sent to the Bearer of the Trumpet. He gestured with it to his mouth, placed one foot forward and the other back, waiting for when he will be commanded to blow. So beware of the Blast [an-nafkha]." So reflect upon the creation and their humiliation, their brokenness, and their submission at the time of being sent forth, in fear of this striking down [as-sa'qa] and in anticipation of what will be decreed for them of happiness [sa'ada] or wretchedness [shaqawa]. And you are among them, broken like their brokenness, bewildered like their bewilderment. Rather, if you were in the world [ad-dunya] among the affluent and the rich who live in luxury, then the kings of the earth on that Day are the most humiliated people of the gathering place, the smallest of them, and the most contemptible. They are trodden underfoot like a speck of dust. And at that time, the wild beasts from the deserts and the mountains come forth, their heads lowered, mingled with the creation after their wildness, humbled for the Day of Resurrection [Yawm an-Nushur], not because of any sin they were defiled by, but their being gathered was due to the severity of the striking down [as-sa'qa] and the terror of the Blast [nafkha], and that preoccupied them from fleeing from the creation and being wild towards them.

a.g: They do not await except one blast which will seize them while they are disputing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وحذرهم أن يأخذهم بغتة وهم لا يشعرون فقال "ما ينظرون إلا صيحة واحدة تأخذهم وهم يخصمون فلا يستطيعون توصية ولا إلى أهلهم يرجعون"
Indeed, I warn them that it may seize them suddenly while they are unaware. "They await nothing but a single blast [ṣayḥa] that will seize them while they are disputing [yakhṣimūn]. Then they will not be able to make a bequest [waṣiyya], nor will they return to their people."

a.g: And they will not be able [to give] any instruction, nor to their people can they return.
And the Horn will be blown; and at once from the graves to their Lord they will hasten.
They will say, "O woe to us! Who has raised us up from our sleeping place?" [The reply will be], "This is what the Most Merciful had promised, and the messengers told the truth."
It will not be but one blast, and at once they are all brought present before Us.
So today no soul will be wronged at all, and you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do.
Indeed the companions of Paradise, that Day, will be amused in [joyful] occupation -
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال الأوزاعى ﴿ فى شغل فاكهون ﴾ {} قال شغلهم افتضاض الأبكار.
Indeed, the inhabitants of Paradise [Jannah] are in a state of blissful occupation [fi shughlin fākihūn]. Al-Awzā'ī said regarding 'in a state of blissful occupation [fi shughlin fākihūn]': Their occupation [shughluhum] is the deflowering of virgins [iftidād al-abkār].

a.g: They and their spouses - in shade, reclining on adorned couches.
For them therein is fruit, and for them is whatever they request [or wish]
[And] "Peace," a word from a Merciful Lord.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال الله تعالى: " ولدينا مزيد ". قال بعض المفسرين: يأتي أهل الجنة في وقت المزيد ثلاث تحف من عند رب العالمين؛ أحداها: هدية من عند الله تعالى ليس عندهم في الجنان مثلها فذلك قوله تعالى: " فلا تعلم نفس ما أخفي لهم من قرة أعين " والثانية: السلام عليهم من ربهم، فيزيد ذلك على الهدية فضلاً وهو قوله تعالى: " سلام قولاً من رب رحيم " والثالثة: يقول الله تعالى: إني عنكم راض فيكون ذلك أفضل من الهدية والتسليم فذلك قوله تعالى: " ورضوان من الله أكبر " أي من النعيم الذي هم فيه فهذا فضل رضا الله تعالى وهو ثمرة رضا العبد.
Indeed, God Almighty has said: "And with Us is increase [mazīd]." Some of the interpreters have said: The people of Paradise will come, at the time of the increase [mazīd], to three gifts from the Lord of the worlds; the first of them: a gift [hadiyya] from God Almighty, the like of which they do not have in the Gardens, and that is His saying, Almighty: "So no soul knows what has been hidden for them of comfort for the eyes [qurrat a'yun]." And the second: Peace [salām] upon them from their Lord, and that increases upon the gift in grace, and it is His saying, Almighty: "Peace [salām]—a word from a Lord Most Merciful." And the third: God Almighty says: Indeed, I am pleased with you [rāḍin 'ankum], and that becomes better than the gift and the greeting of peace [taslīm], and that is His saying, Almighty: "And approval [riḍwān] from God is greater," meaning, than the bliss [na'īm] they are in. So this is the grace of the pleasure [riḍā] of God Almighty, and it is the fruit of the pleasure [riḍā] of the servant.

a.g: [Then He will say], "But stand apart today, you criminals.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وعن محمد بن صبيح قال كان رجل يغتسل في الفرات فمر به رجل على الشاطىء يقرأ وامتازوا اليوم أيها المجرمون فلم يزل الرجل يضطرب حتى غرق ومات
And from Muhammad ibn Subayh, he said: A man was bathing in the Euphrates, and a man passed by him on the shore reciting, "And stand apart today, O criminals [al-mujrimun]." And the man did not cease to be agitated until he drowned and died.

a.g: Did I not enjoin upon you, O children of Adam, that you not worship Satan - [for] indeed, he is to you a clear enemy -
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وَقَالَ تَعَالَى أَلَمْ أَعْهَدْ إِلَيْكُمْ يَا بَنِي آدَمَ أَنْ لَا تَعْبُدُوا الشَّيْطَانَ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّ مُبِينٌ فَقَدْ عَرَفَ الْعَدُوُّ لَا مَحَالَ فَيَنْبَغِي أَنْ يَشْتَغِلَ بِمُجَاهَدَتِهِ وَقَدْ عَرَفَ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ عَدَاوَتَهُ فِي مَوَاضِعَ كَثِيرَةٍ مِنْ كِتَابِهِ لِيُؤْمِنَ بِهِ وَيَحْتَرِزَ عَنْهُ فَقَالَ تَعَالَى إِنَّ الشَّيْطَانَ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّ فَاتَّخِذُوهُ عَدُوًّا إِنَّمَا يَدْعُو حِزْبَهُ لِيَكُونُوا مِنْ أَصْحَابِ السَّعِيرِ وَقَالَ تَعَالَى أَلَمْ أَعْهَدْ إِلَيْكُمْ يَا بَنِي آدَمَ أَنْ لَا تَعْبُدُوا الشَّيْطَانَ إِنَّهُ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّ مُبِينٌ فَيَنْبَغِي لِلْعَبْدِ أَنْ يَشْتَغِلَ بِدَفْعِ الْعَدُوِّ عَنْ نَفْسِهِ لَا بِالسُّؤَالِ عَنْ أَصْلِهِ وَنَسَبِهِ وَمَسْكَنِهِ نَعَمْ يَنْبَغِي أَنْ يَسْأَلَ عَنْ سِلَاحِهِ لِيَدْفَعَهُ عَنْ نَفْسِهِ وَسِلَاحُ الشَّيْطَانِ الْهَوَى وَالشَّهَوَاتُ وَذَلِكَ كَافٍ لِلْعَالِمِينَ
Indeed, did I not covenant with you, O children of Adam, that you should not worship Satan [ash-shaytan]? Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy ['aduwwun mubin]. So the enemy ['aduww] is known, without doubt. Therefore, it is incumbent to be occupied with striving against him [mujahadatihi]. And Allah, glorified is He, has made known his enmity ['adawatahu] in many places of His Book, so that one may believe in it and be wary of him. So He, glorified is He, said: "Indeed, Satan [ash-shaytan] is an enemy to you, so take him as an enemy. He only invites his party to be among the companions of the Blaze." And He, glorified is He, said: "Indeed, did I not covenant with you, O children of Adam, that you should not worship Satan [ash-shaytan]? Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy ['aduwwun mubin]." Therefore, it is incumbent upon the servant ['abd] to be occupied with repelling the enemy ['aduww] from his soul [nafs], not with asking about his origin, his lineage, or his abode. Yes, it is incumbent to ask about his weapon [silah] so that he may repel him from his soul [nafs]. And the weapon [silah] of Satan [ash-shaytan] is caprice [al-hawa] and the appetites [ash-shahawat]. And that is sufficient for those who know [al-'alimin].

a.g: And that you worship [only] Me? This is a straight path.
And he had already led astray from among you much of creation, so did you not use reason?
This is the Hellfire which you were promised.
[Enter to] burn therein today for what you used to deny."
That Day, We will seal over their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify about what they used to earn.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
حتى حملوا قوله تعالى: ﴿ وتكلمنا أيديهم وتشهد أرجلهم ﴾ { سورة يس:65 } زعموا أن ذلك كله بلسان الحال.
Indeed, they carried His saying, the Most High: "And their hands [aydīhim] will speak to Us, and their feet [arjuluhum] will bear witness" [Surah Yā Sīn: 65] — they claimed that all of that is by the language of state [lisān al-ḥāl].

a.g: And if We willed, We could have obliterated their eyes, and they would race to [find] the path, and how could they see?
And if We willed, We could have deformed them, [paralyzing them] in their places so they would not be able to proceed, nor could they return.
And he to whom We grant long life We reverse in creation; so will they not understand?
And We did not give Prophet Muhammad, knowledge of poetry, nor is it befitting for him. It is not but a message and a clear Qur'an
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى وما علمناه الشعر وما ينبغي له وأكثر ما اعتاده الوعاظ من الأشعار ما يتعلق بالتواصف في العشق وجمال المعشوق وروح الوصال وألم الفراق والمجلس لا يحوى إلا أجلاف العوام وبواطنهم مشحونة بالشهوات وقلوبهم غير منفكة عن الالتفات إلى الصور المليحة فلا تحرك الأشعار من قلوبهم إلا ما هو مستكن فيها فتشتعل فيها نيران الشهوات فيزعقون ويتواجدون وأكثر ذلك أو كله يرجع إلى نوع فساد فلا ينبغي أن يستعمل من الشعر إلا ما فيه موعظة أو حكمة على سبيل استشهاد واستئناس
Indeed, We have not taught him [the Prophet] poetry [shi'r], nor is it fitting for him. And most of what the preachers [wu'āẓ] have accustomed themselves to from poetry pertains to mutual description in passionate love ['ishq] and the beauty of the Beloved [ma'shūq] and the spirit of union [wiṣāl] and the pain of separation [furāq]. And the gathering [majlis] contains none but the crude among the common folk ['awāmm], and their inner selves [bawāṭin] are laden with base desires [shahawāt], and their hearts [qulūb] are not detached from turning towards beautiful forms [ṣuwar]. So the poetry stirs in their hearts only what lies dormant within them, and the fires of their desires blaze within them, and they cry out and become ecstatic. And most of that, or all of it, returns to a kind of corruption [fasād]. So it is not fitting to employ from poetry except that which contains an admonition [maw'iẓa] or wisdom [ḥikma] by way of citing evidence [istishhād] and seeking familiarity [isti'nas].

a.g: To warn whoever is alive and justify the word against the disbelievers.
Do they not see that We have created for them from what Our hands have made, grazing livestock, and [then] they are their owners?
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
يا هرون قعدت على السرير ولبست الحرير واسبلت سترا دون بابك وتشبهت بالحجبة برب العالمين ثم أقعدت أجنادك الظلمة دون بابك وسترك يظلمون الناس ولا ينصفون يشربون الخمور ويضربون من يشربها ويزنون ويحدون الزاني ويسرقون ويقطعون السارق أفلا كانت هذه الأحكام عليك وعليهم قبل أن تحكم بها على الناس فكيف بك يا هرون غدا إذا نادى المنادي من قبل الله تعالى احشرو الذين ظلموا وأزواجهم أي الظلمة وأعوان الظلمة فقدمت بين يدي الله تعالى ويداك مغلولتان إلى عنقك لا يفكهما إلا عدلك وإنصافك والظالمون حولك وأنت لهم سابق وإمام إلى النار كأني بك يا هرون وقد أخذت بضيق الخناق ووردت المساق وأنت ترى حسناتك في ميزان غيرك وسيئات غيرك في ميزانك زيادة عن سيئاتك بلاء على بلاء وظلمة فوق ظلمة
O Harun, you have sat upon the throne and worn silk, and you have lowered a curtain before your door, and you have resembled the chamberlains of the Lord of the Worlds. Then you have stationed your dark soldiers [ajnād] before your door and your curtain, and they oppress [yazlimūn] the people and do not establish justice. They drink wine and strike the one who drinks it, and they fornicate and punish the fornicator, and they steal and amputate the thief. Should not these rulings have been upon you and upon them before you judged by them upon the people? So how will it be for you, O Harun, tomorrow when the Caller calls out from the presence of God, the Exalted: "Gather those who did wrong [zalamū] and their companions" — meaning the oppressors [zulamā'] and the helpers of oppression? Then you will be brought before God, the Exalted, with your hands bound to your neck, and nothing will release them except your justice [‘adl] and your fairness [insāf]. And the wrongdoers [zālimūn] will be around you, and you are for them a forerunner and an imam to the Fire. It is as if I see you, O Harun, taken by the tightness of the throat, and you have arrived at the place of driving, and you see your good deeds in the scale of another, and the sins of another in your scale, added to your own sins — a trial [balā'] upon a trial, and a darkness [zulma] above a darkness.

a.g: And We have tamed them for them, so some of them they ride, and some of them they eat.
And for them therein are [other] benefits and drinks, so will they not be grateful?
But they have taken besides Allah [false] deities that perhaps they would be helped.
They are not able to help them, and they [themselves] are for them soldiers in attendance.
So let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, We know what they conceal and what they declare.
Does man not consider that We created him from a [mere] sperm-drop - then at once he is a clear adversary?
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال أولم ير الإنسان أنا خلقناه من نطفة فإذا هو خصيم مبين فتكرير ذكر النطفة في الكتاب العزيز ليس ليسمع لفظه ويترك التفكر في معناه فانظر الآن إلى النطفة وهي قطرة من الماء قذرة لو تركت ساعة ليضربها الهواء فسدت وانتنت كيف أخرجها رب الأرباب من الصلب والترائب وكيف جمع بين الذكر والأنثى وألقى الألفة والمحبة في قلوبهم وكيف قادهم بسلسلة المحبة والشهوة الى الاجتماع وكيف استخرج النطفة من الرجل بحركة الوقاع وكيف استجلب دم الحيض من أعماق العروق وجمعه في الرحم ثم كيف خلق المولود من النطفة وسقاه بماء الحيض وغذاه حتى نما وربا وكبر وكيف جعل النطفة وهي بيضاء مشرقة علقة حمراء ثم كيف جعلها مضغة ثم كيف قسم أجزاء النطفة وهي متساوية متشابهة إلى العظام والأعصاب والعروق والأوتار واللحم ثم كيف ركب من اللحوم والأعصاب والعروق الأعضاء الظاهرة فدور الرأس وشق السمع والبصر والأنف والفم وسائر المنافذ ثم مد اليد والرجل وقسم رءوسها بالأصابع وقسم الأصابع بالأنامل ثم كيف ركب الأعضاء الباطنة من القلب والمعدة والكبد والطحال والرئة والرحم والمثانة والأمعاء كل واحد على شكل مخصوص ومقدار مخصوص لعمل مخصوص ثم كيف قسم كل عضو من هذه الأعضاء بأقسام أخر فركب العين من سبع طبقات لكل طبقة وصف مخصوص وهيئة مخصوصة لو فقدت طبقة منها أو زالت صفة من صفاتها تعطلت العين عن الإبصار فلو ذهبنا إلى أن نصف ما في آحاد هذه الأعضاء من العجائب والآيات لانقضي فيه الأعمار فانظر الآن إلى العظام وهي أجسام صلبة قوية كيف خلقها من نطفة سخيفة رقيقة ثم جعلها قواما للبدن وعمادا له ثم قدرها بمقادير مختلفة وأشكال مختلفة فمنه صغير وكبير وطويل ومستدير ومجوف ومصمت وعريض ودقيق ولما كان الإنسان محتاجا إلى الحركة بجملة بدنه وببعض أعضائه مفتقرا للتردد في حاجاته لم يجعل عظمه
Indeed, does man not see that We created him from a drop [nutfah], and then he becomes a clear adversary? The repeated mention of the drop [nutfah] in the Mighty Book is not for you to hear its word and abandon reflection upon its meaning. So look now at the drop [nutfah], which is a droplet of foul water; if left for an hour for the air to strike it, it would spoil and become putrid. How did the Lord of lords bring it forth from the loins and the ribs? And how did He bring together the male and the female, and cast affection [ulfah] and love [mahabbah] into their hearts [qulub]? And how did He lead them by the chain of love [mahabbah] and desire [shahwah] to union? And how did He extract the drop [nutfah] from the man by the movement of intercourse? And how did He draw the blood of menstruation from the depths of the veins and gather it in the womb? Then how did He create the infant from the drop [nutfah] and nourish it with the water of menstruation and feed it until it grew, developed, and became large? And how did He make the drop [nutfah], which is white and shining, into a clinging clot ['alaqah] that is red? Then how did He make it a chewed lump [mudghah]? Then how did He divide the parts of the drop [nutfah], which are equal and similar, into bones, nerves, veins, tendons, and flesh? Then how did He construct from the flesh, nerves, and veins the outward limbs: the roundness of the head, the splitting open of hearing and sight, the nose, the mouth, and all the other apertures? Then He extended the hand and the leg, and divided their ends into fingers, and divided the fingers into fingertips. Then how did He construct the inward limbs: the heart [qalb], the stomach, the liver, the spleen, the lung, the womb, the bladder, and the intestines, each one with a specific form and a specific measure for a specific function? Then how did He divide each of these limbs into other divisions? He constructed the eye from seven layers, each layer with a specific attribute and a specific constitution; if a single layer from them were lost, or an attribute from its attributes were removed, the eye would be incapacitated from vision. If we were to begin describing the wonders and signs in each one of these limbs, lifetimes would be exhausted in it. So look now at the bones, which are solid, strong bodies; how did He create them from a weak, delicate drop [nutfah]? Then He made them the framework [qiwam] for the body and its support. Then He proportioned them with different measures and different forms: among them small and large, long and round, hollow and solid, broad and slender. And since man is in need of movement with his entire body and with some of his limbs, and is in need of going about for his needs, He did not make his bone...

a.g: And he presents for Us an example and forgets his [own] creation. He says, "Who will give life to bones while they are disintegrated?"
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فاستدل بالابتداء على الإعادة، قال تعالى: قل يحييها الذي أنشأها أول مرة.
Indeed, He establishes the argument from the First Creation [al-ibtida'] for the Restoration [al-i'ada]. The Most High says: "Say, 'He will give them life who produced them the first time.'"

a.g: Say, "He will give them life who produced them the first time; and He is, of all creation, Knowing."
[It is] He who made for you from the green tree, fire, and then from it you ignite.
Is not He who created the heavens and the earth Able to create the likes of them? Yes, [it is so]; and He is the Knowing Creator.
His command is only when He intends a thing that He says to it, "Be," and it is.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ومن هذا القبيل في كنايته عن الاقتدار قوله تعالى: ﴿ إنما قولنا لشيء إذا أردناه أن نقول له كن فيكون ﴾ فإن ظاهره ممتنع إذ قوله كن إن كان خطابا للشيء قبل وجوده فهو محال إذا المعدوم لا يفهم الخطاب حتى يمثل وإن كان بعد الوجود فهو مستغن عن التكوين ولكن لما كانت هذه الكناية أوقع في النفوس في تفهيم غاية الاقتدار عدل إليها.
Indeed, from this category in its allusion to absolute power [al-iqtidar] is His saying, the Most High: "Indeed, Our command [qawluna] for a thing, when We will it, is that We say to it, 'Be,' and it is." [36:82]. For its outward meaning [zahiruhu] is impossible, for His saying "Be" – if it were an address [khitaban] to the thing before its existence, that is absurd, since the non-existent [al-ma'dum] does not comprehend the address until it is given form. And if it were after existence, then it is in no need of being brought into being [al-takwin]. However, since this allusion [al-kinaya] is more impactful upon the souls [al-nufus] in conveying the ultimate degree of power [ghayat al-iqtidar], He turned to it.

a.g: So exalted is He in whose hand is the realm of all things, and to Him you will be returned.
